alert.note: Alert for Coosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 1:18PM CDT until April 05 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton and Coosa. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 110 PM CDT, stream flow estimates and automated rain gauges are showing elevated water level conditions continue across the advisory area. - Areas and roadways near and along Walnut Creek are the most likely places to experience minor flooding however elevated stream conditions may be likely anywhere in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clanton, Goodwater, Rockford, Kellyton, Lyle, Moriah, Dollar, Bentleyville, Higgins Ferry Park, Pentonville, Mitchell Lake, Hanover, Crewsville, Cottage Grove, Verbena, Nixburg, Highway 9 and Highway 22, Hatchet, Bradford and Gap Of The Mountain.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
